page.title: 11GAZETTE NEWSPAPER,FLEETWOOD
page.content: This particular newspaper has two main offices,one in Cleveleys,and one in Blackpool,where the newspaper is printed. The newspaper is distributed over the Fylde Coast and Over Wyre. The paper has about twenty reporters which are divided into three groups. These groups cover a) {NORTH FYLDE, } b){SOUTH FYLDE,}c){BLACKPOOL. The news in the North Fylde is transported to Blackpool by a{ {"teleprinter"}(a sort of electronic type-writer that prints the news on paper at the head office in Blackpool),or a {"copy-typist"}(a person who copies what is being said through the telephone).The "Gazette" was connected with a free newspaper called "The Leader".This was closed down,but plans are being made for a "re- opening".All past copies of the "Gazette"are stored at Blackpool.
